name: Haiku Cannery Inn B&B

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Last year we loved the Meadows Cottage but did not have as long to stay this time so opted for the Bamboo Suite. Loved the Haiku Cannery every bit as much. It is a small suite with fantastic breezes on one side of the great house (which you have access to for PC and sitting if you want) and Benny delivers a breakfast treat right to the porch each morning. Love the location, love the room, love the atmosphere of the property and compliment Benni as the best hostess! Hope we get another chance in the future to visit yet again!
reviews.title: Second Year--just as great!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Haiku is a wonderful, tucked away town on the beautiful green, lush side of Maui. The Haiku Cannery Inn was such a find. It's peaceful, quiet, and such a nice change from the busy, beach-side commercial scene. Thank you, Benni, for such a lovely stay. We hope to be back soon!
reviews.title: Just wonderful!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed in one of the guest rooms inside the main house, and we love it! The house is amazing, and breakfast was serve-yourself when you wake up, very relaxed.....just how we liked it. The owner, Benni, is a Hawaiian native and gives great advice on places to eat and things to see. The price was also great, so overall I would give this place 5 stars and recommend it to anyone!!
reviews.title: my favorite place to stay in Maui!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Haiku Cannery Inn is a beautifully restored pineapple cannery manager's home situated in a lush Hawaiian rain garden of red ginger and bamboo. The main house has wonderful architectural details and is the most beautiful manager's house I have ever been in. It is also filled with lovely antiques. The owner, who has lived in this house since the 1970s, is friendly, helpful, and full of fascinating stories about the area. My husband and I travel frequently to all the Hawaiian islands, and this inn is our favorite place to stay in Maui. The house is immaculate and the grounds well tended. The beds are comfortable and the area is very quiet. You have a choice of cottages or rooms in the main house. Breakfast was wonderful; fresh breads, Kula strawberries, pineapple, papaya, cereal, bagels, coffee. We love this inn and can't wait to return.
reviews.title: True Hawaiian Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We enjoyed the cottage where we stayed for 5 days. It was perfectly equiped, spacious and very light. The property has a nice garden and is very quiet. You can easily find some shops at 5 minutes drive.
reviews.title: Very nice cottage in a beautiful place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: We stayed in the cottage and had an amazing time! Clean and well stocked with tons of space to enjoy both inside and outside. The owner was great and very helpful. We arrived late and I was thrilled to find the cottage even had essential groceries like bread, milk, fruit, cereal, and juice for us! Very beautiful setting and we loved the fruit trees. Stayed with my entire family, including two kids and grandma. This space was perfect for everyone from my 1.5 year old toddler to my 88 year old grandma. Highly recommend this for families who want a relaxing Hawaiian vacation and not another stay in a hotel resort.
reviews.title: Perfect family vacation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed in the Bamboo Suite for about six nights the end of November/beginning of December 2010. The suite is actually a separate little cabin from the main house. It's tastefully decorated and was very comfortable for two. We loved pretty much everything about the place from our hostess to the overall location to the suite itself. We cannot wait to return.
reviews.title: Five stars - didn't want to leave

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All that said, here are a few know-before-you-go items so that your expectations are in line with reality.
reviews.title: Great time in the Upcountry

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled on business
reviews.text: It rained just about every night. It's a soothing rain and we loved it, but know that it can be rainy over here at intervals. It also rained a light mist during the day almost every day. Again, it didn't last long and it didn't bother us a bit, but just be aware.
reviews.title: Lovely Cottage and Lush Grounds

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For those who are really self-conscious, know that the Bamboo Suite has louvers at the front door (with screens) and at the bathroom door.
reviews.title: Home away from home ... awesome

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in the Sunrise Room, and it felt like a suite. Fresh cut flowers were in the room on arrival. The two twin beds were pushed together and made up as a king. It was the most comfortable bed I believe I've ever slept in. I didn't want to get out of bed--which may be normal for some people, but that is very unlike me! The bedroom was incredibly spacious, the shower the largest stall I've ever seen, and a walk-in closet. There were windows on two sides as well as two sides of the attached private bath. We kept them open for a glorious soft breeze and fresh air throughout the night. Woke up so refreshed.
reviews.title: I think I found my dream home...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As another reviewer mentioned, be prepared for a couple bugs here and there--as well as the cutest little geckos clinging to the front door when you come back at night. Small price to pay for the tranquility of this quiet oasis, the views from the front porch where we had breakfast every day, and the big fluffy towels. Breakfast was exactly what we like - choice of cereals (including oatmeal), teas, coffee, pastries, bagel, yogurt, fresh fruit -- and yum! a babybel cheese for each of us. Lots of organic products as well.
reviews.title: The Spirit of Aloha in Haiku

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location was great if you are planning on exploring the island. About 45 minutes to the beaches of West Maui and South Maui, right off Hana Highway, close to the shops, convenience & airport in Kahului, and probably the closest you can stay to Haleakala - which means you don't have to get up quite as early if you want to reach the summit before sunrise. Not a whole lot of restaurant choices in Haiku, but plenty in Paia.
reviews.title: Enjoy the magic of historical Maui as if you were in your own home

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Only word of caution: traffic can get heavy around Paia around commute times, so keep that in mind if you need to get to the airport on time!
reviews.title: Amazing Inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Thank you, Benni!
reviews.title: couldnt be any better

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in the Meadows Cottage for 5 fabulous nights in May. We loved the location; it allowed us easy drives to the South Shore for snorkeling, to Haleakala National Park and to the Road to Hana! There are many stores, restaurants and markets within a 30 minute radius.
reviews.title: AHHH....LOVELY
Excellent Stay!!!
reviews.text: The cottage however is the main highlight at the end of a virtual rain forest driveway. It has obviously been built with love and all we needed was at our fingertips. The views and peaceful location will relax them most wired of us!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: Benni and Allison managed to quietly pop up and check on us to assure all our needs were met.
reviews.title: Amazing Cottage....loved it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011
reviews.text: Originally I was a bit leery about staying 5 nights at the same place as we enjoy moving around but I can honestly say, we would not have minded staying here longer!
reviews.title: Loved it
A wonderful spot
reviews.text: We have been vacationing on Maui since 1969-always staying at various resort hotels-first stay at a B&B on Maui and will never stay at a resort hotel again. I would highly recommend Haiku Cannery Inn-we plan on going back to it. Lovely house/accomodations/location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This newly opened bed and breakfast is a lovely spot to lay your head at night. Benni, the innkeeper and owner, is a lovely woman and host. In stark contrast to the bustling beach resorts, the Haiku Cannery Inn is a quiet plantation home nestled in the lush forest of Haiku. At night you'll fall asleep to the sound of tropical rains and wake up to sunshine. At night be prepared to forgo TV for a live version of Animal Planet on your windows (geckos chasing bugs - on the outside of the window not the inside!). It's like being in the rainforest while still being a short drive from towns and the beach. A great stop for any traveler.
reviews.title: Peaceful, Elegant & Homey Getaway

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled on business
reviews.text: I found the Haiku Cannery Inn on this site and was so pleasantly surprised. The property is just magical with it's own rain forest. I stayed in one of the little private units and had birds and animals outside my window. Amazing. The home was elegantly appointed, very clean and modern. I had a little kitchenette that was stocked with fresh fruit, rice milk which I had requested and teas and coffees. My bathroom had some delicious eco products that would rival a posh boutique hotel. There were fresh flowers in my room which is always a lovely touch. Breakfast was served in the main home which was light, airy and elegant. The food was fresh and healthy and the other guests hip and mellow. It was private and cozy, yet had the feeling I was being catered too. Great service. The Inn keeper had amazing stories about the history of Maui and told us some very cool places to visit and eat. Highly recommend. I can't wait to go back with my family. Private and safe for kids. A huge field and swing are also on the property.
reviews.title: Loved it, can't wait to go back.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Haiku Cannery Inn is so peaceful and relaxing. My husband and I really loved the property and the hospitality of the owner, Benni. The rooms were stunning! An airy private cottage with a modern kitchenette with eucalyptus flooring including beautiful one of a kind art. We could really tell Benni takes pride in the beauty of her property. I loved the fact that there is no tv! We were able to wake up and enjoy our beautiful surroundings without any distractions. Benni has a wonderful organic breakfast- by far the best breakfast I've had at a B & B. The location is perfect- right up the street from the town overlooking the ocean. It feels like you are in the jungle- there is even wild chickens walking everywhere! Haiku is off the beaten path from the tourists, its much more secluded and private, making it much more enjoyable and romantic vacation. My husband and I were very pleased with Haiku Cannery Inn and will be coming back very soon!
reviews.title: Absolutely Beautiful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed 3 nights including our anniversary. The owner made us feel very welcome and accommodated several food allergies. We enjoyed a bounty of fresh tropical fruit. The room was in its own private building, very light and airy, with tasteful, non-cluttered decor, a comfortable medium-firm bed, and a kitchenette. We particularly liked the tropical foliage and many exotic birdcalls. It's only a very short drive to shopping, post office, and downhill bike tours, not much farther to the beach and two artsy little towns, Makawao and Paia.
reviews.title: Really relax in exotic but homey comfort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010
reviews.text: My sister and I was so happy to find Haiku Cannery Inn. Not only was it close to the beaches and shops but also the North Shore, Hana Highway and Haleakala. It was a wonderful experience staying at this beautiful historic plantation home with an ocean view from the veranda. Our host, Benni, was really wonderful and charming and really made us feel at home. Our room was beautiful, clean, and comfortable and the inn was set off the main road so it was really quiet. Our breakfast was delicious with fresh fruit, cereals, and local breads and all at a super reasonable prices. We will for sure stay here again on our next visit to Maui.
reviews.title: Hawaii Paradise--Haiku Cannery Inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Greatly enjoyed our stay here in the Sunrise room, which was very spacious, bright and airy. Convenient for Road to Hana, Haleakala crater, and Mama's Fish House (what a view for dinner!).
reviews.title: Pleasant, affordable and convenient

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: Our host, Benni was very accomodating - coming out with a flashlight as we drove up to the house in the evening, giving us access to laundry machines when we arrived (as this was the second part of our trip), and even putting out breakfast 30 minutes earlier than scheduled our first morning as we indicated we wanted to be heading out early for the road to Hana.
reviews.title: Perfect, gracious, beautiful in every way!
What a stroke of luck in finding this - best place we stayed!
reviews.text: The plantation home is lovely, and we enjoyed eating our take out dinner at the long dining room table and breakfast on the porch, but I felt loud walking on the wood floors from our room to the kitchen or dining room. Also, I had to carefully place the room shades for privacy, and with the windows open the thin shades would blow around so I felt like this room lacked a little privacy - in the event anyone came to the entry way - not that there is much of an issue with only two other rooms; for that reason, I might choose the bamboo suite (which we had originally planned, but were too slow to commit). I peeked in to the Malia room, and it's not as small as I thought it looked in the photo. Would be a fine, pleasant room to stay in for two.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: We were worried a litle woried about no AC, but that was not an issue with the breezes, even in September.
reviews.title: Beautiful, peaceful, authentic. We'll go back any time
BEST PEOPLE ON EARTH
reviews.text: Take the road leading up to the house very carefully/slowly and look for the white sign, we drove past the entry drive twice.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Reserved the Bamboo Suite based on Trip Adviser ratings, we were very pleased with our choice, we stayed for 4 nights.
reviews.title: We loved the Bamboo Suite. Better than a hotel or condo rental!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Bamboo Suite is really more like a cottage, which had everything you could possibly need. It has a kitchenette, equipped with a small ridge (butter, cream cheese, juice, milk, cream), toaster oven, microwave, coffee maker, side drawer with knives and eating utensils. The suite also has a pantry filled with a variety of cereals, coffee, tea's, sugar, honey, microwave popcorn and more, including various plates, mugs and glasses.
reviews.title: Yep, It's a Five!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Every morning we woke to find our breakfast delivered and left just outside our door, in a thermal bag. It consisted of half a papaya each filled with fresh sliced strawberry's, store bought yogourt, two bagels, a huge plate of fresh pineapple, and a huge plate of banana breads and or desert type muffins. It was an excellent breakfast!
reviews.title: Great value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The suite is very large with plenty of room to walk around, without bumping into each other, and had large cabinet for hanging cloths or stowing things out of the way. The bed was comfortable and equipped with a electric blanket. Being Canadian we chuckled at this, thinking it could never get that cold here to actually use it. It did however get quit cool in the evenings at this time of year, but the sheets and blankets were plenty for us. There is no air conditioning, but a huge ceiling fan and large windows provided plenty of cooling and lots of winds blowing through. There is also a small dinning table with four chairs.
reviews.title: It was perfect for us.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bathroom is very unique, in that the shower is actually part of the bathroom and only became a shower when the curtains where drawn... loved the slate tile and the deco tile on the faucet wall... it did take quite a while for the water to get hot, but you can kill time by brushing your teeth while your waiting!
reviews.title: What a Gem
Super Owners
reviews.text: Had to cancel at the last minute due to medical emergency. Owner offered assistance and a full refund. Very gracious people.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed in the Bamboo Suite, a separate little house adjacent to the main house. It reminded us of our time in the Australian Outback in an eco resort. The mynah birds nest in one of the trees adjacent to the Suite and make the most delightful noise at dusk and dawn, but mercifully are quiet during the night. The Haiku Cannery is in a beautiful position high above the ocean in a totally peaceful setting, though only a mile from a commercial center in Haiku with a supermarket and good-value restaurants.
reviews.title: Excellent B&B - convenient for Up Country and Road to Hana

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent one half-day going halfway to Hana - a beautiful drive, and half the sweat of going the whole way. We ate lunch at the Hali'imaile General Store another day - highly recommended. Benni is a wonderful host, as has been described in other postings. The whole place is spotlessly clean.
reviews.title: Wonderful!
peace and quiet
reviews.text: We will definitely return.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were only able to stay one night (3 night minimum) and Benni was gracious enough to make it work for us. Very clean and well kept up. The photos on the website are exactly as it appears. I made an off comment to Benni that my husband likes whole wheat bagels in the morning and she made sure to have them for him. Such a simple, yet, nice touch in our opinion. We planned a trip to Haleakala National Park the next day so it was a perfect location.
reviews.title: Amazing everything

description: Beautifully restored 1920 plantation manager's home plus separate family-friendly 2 bedroom cottage on three lush and private acres in the best part of Haiku, Maui. Listed in Hawaii's historic register. Quiet and secluded yet close to all that Upcountry and East Maui has to offer. Large, elegant rooms. En-suite baths. Your host family are Hawaii locals with 40 years at this property and have all the real information you need to make your stay on Maui the best.
